title: The vague goals of Trump's Board of Peace
subhead: Tasked with rebuilding Gaza and ending the conflict in the territory, the global body established by the Republican president has yet to deliver any tangible results, five months after the ceasefire was announced.

title: Mélenchon's strategy of conflict under fire after far-right activist's killing
Zuckerberg tells jury he regrets slow progress on spotting under-13s on Instagram: 'Wish we could have gotten there sooner'
Merz says Germany does not need same fighter jets as France
subhead: Chancellor Friedrich Merz signaled that Germany could leave the Future Combat Aircraft System project, a French, German and Spanish joint venture aimed at replacing France's Rafale jet and the German and Spanish Eurofighter planes by 2040.

title: Leila Shahid, former Palestinian diplomat, has died
subhead: Shahid served as her country's representative in France from 1993 to 2006, and then at the European Union, in Brussels, from 2006 to 2015.

title: Is it ever a good idea to… wear cufflinks?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: Anthropic, the AI start-up that dares to defy Donald Trump
subhead: Dario Amodei, the CEO of the artificial intelligence company, acknowledged disagreements with the White House over the regulation and military use of his technology. This is a rare stance in the US, where the tech industry has generally pledged allegiance to the president.

title: Hacker accessed data from 1.2 million bank accounts, French Economy Ministry says

Epstein scandal divides the MAGA world and weakens Trump
US energy chief urges IEA to 'drop the climate'
Man missing in Loire River as France hit by record 35 days of rain
Snow camping at ski resorts: 'Our friends think we're crazy'
Kyiv's fourth winter at war has spared no one

Mexico seeks to bring its archaeological treasures back from France
Némésis, the identitarian activists behind feminist masks
subhead: Named for the Greek goddess of retribution, the French group specializes in provocative protests and perpetually blames immigrants and Muslims for sexual violence. Since its creation in 2019, members have regularly infiltrated left-wing protests to shout their own slogans.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: Chinese kung-fu robots steal the show in world's most-watched TV program
subhead: Watched by 600 million viewers, the annual gala broadcast by national television channel CCTV for Lunar New Year's Eve serves as a showcase for China's advances in robotics and artificial intelligence.

title: 'The spectacle of European disunity in the face of pressure from both the United States and China is infuriating'
After Munich Security Conference, Europeans have a duty to unite
'The fall of the cumbersome Jack Lang is seen as providential for France's political spectrum, which remains paralyzed by his cultural legacy'
